subject: AI & Agents
title: GANs: AI That Creates by Competing
description: A quick win: understand GANs: AI That Creates by Competing.

hook.text: In 2014, Ian Goodfellow sketched an idea in a bar that would let AI generate photorealistic faces.

buildup.text: Generative Adversarial Networks pit two neural networks against each other.

discovery.text: One generates fakes. The other tries to detect them. Both get better in a feedback loop.

twist.text: GANs now generate faces so real that humans can't tell they're fake.

climax.text: The same technology powers deepfakes, art generators, and drug molecule design.

quiz.question: How do GANs work?
options: Two networks compete â€” one generates, one detects fakes
A single network corrects its own mistakes
Data is manually curated by humans
